info.title: Cloud Backup REST API Reference
info.description:
Overview

Cloud Backup is a service embedded within the Cloud Manager platform that provides backup and restore capabilities for protection and long-term archiving of your data residing in Cloud Volumes ONTAP and on-premises ONTAP clusters (AFF/FAS/OTS). By using this service, you can automatically generate and store backups in an object store in the public or private cloud account of your choice, and you can easily restore data any time and to any location, as per your requirements.

There are nine categories of endpoints defined within Cloud Backup.

  • backup
  • catalog
  • cloud
  • job
  • license
  • restore
  • single file-level restore (SFR)
  • working environment
  • license
  • ransomware scan

REST implementation

HTTP methods

MethodDescription
POSTCreate an object instance
GETRetrieve an object instance or collection
PATCHUpdate an existing object
DELETERemove an existing object

Request headers

Request headerDescription
AuthorizationRequired. Contains the JWT access token
x-agent-idRequired. Contains the Cloud Manager Connector ID.
x-netapp-cache-controlUsing this header bypasses the local cache and retrieves actual data from upstream sources such as a Cloud Manager SaaS application and ONTAP clusters.

Query parameters

You can use query parameters with endpoints in the following components:

ComponentQuery parameter
sfraccountId(required),
volumeId,
snapshotId.
backupaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId,
volumeId,
snapshotId.
restoreaccountId(required).
Working environmentaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId,
volumeId,
snapshotId.
cloudaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId,
volumeId,
snapshotId,awsAccountId,
regionCode,
subscriptionId,
vaultName,
projectId,
jobId.
licenseaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId.
catalogaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId.
jobaccountId(required),
jobId.

Response headers

This API uses the standard HTTP response headers common with all Cloud Manager APIs. See REST implementation for more information.

HTTP status codes

HTTP status codeDescription
200OK:Returned for successful operation completion
400Bad Request:Returned if the input is malformed and could not be parsed
401Unauthorized:Returned if user authentication failed or the token has expired
403Forbidden:Returned for authorization errors depending on the resource and token
Error handling

There are two processes involved with error handling and processing.

  • The error is logged for supportability
  • The error is also returned to the caller for any specific handling
cURL examples

Retrieve specific volume details

This example retrieves the details of a specific volume that has been backed up by using Cloud Backup.

curl -X GET "https://cloudmanager.cloud.netapp.com/account/(account_id)/providers/cloudmanager_cbs/api/v1/backup/working-environment/(working_environment_id)/volume/(volume_id)" -H "accept: application/json" -H "authorization: (user token)"
Frequently asked questions

There are multiple versions of the same command. Which version should I use?

If there are multiple versions of the same API endpoint, make sure to use the latest version of the API. The version of each endpoint is mentioned in the path.

What’s the difference between a user token and service token and why do we need two types of token authorization ?

A user token is used for communication between a user (or the UI) and the Cloud Manager REST APIs, whereas the service token is used for communication between two services (machine-to-machine interaction) in the Cloud Manager platform. The type of token required to invoke an API is documented in the description of each endpoint.

What is difference between SFR Cloud Backup APIs and Catalog Cloud Backup APIs?

The SFR Cloud Backup APIs provide the option to use the Browse and Restore feature while performing a volume level or single/multiple file restore operation from backups stored on the cloud.The Catalog Cloud Backup APIs have a "Search and Restore" feature, which enables you to search for a specific file from all backups stored on Amazon S3 cloud storage and then perform a restore operation. It enables you to perform a quick and focused search for files across all the backups in the cloud and gives you the option to narrow down the searches by using multiple search criteria.

Why has the export file system API endpoint under the SFR category been deprecated?

Previously, Cloud Backup relied on an additional cloud restore virtual machine (VM) instance for exporting the Snapshot copies and creating a file list when you initiated a file restore operation from the Restore dashboard. Now, instead of creating an additional cloud restore VM instance during a file-level restore operation, Cloud Backup deploys a restore container on the Connector VM instance. These containers contain the latest Active Data Connector image (version 1.4). This implementation doesn't require the file system to be exported, therefore the export file system API endpoint under the SFR category is deprecated.

Why have the API endpoints under the jobs category changed?

The old job API endpoints have been replaced with a set of new job API endpoints. The functionality of the new endpoints differs from the old ones. Previously, the job endpoints were used to retrieve a list of jobs and the details of a particular job. The new job API endpoints enable services to create job entries, update the status of a job directly in the database, and retrieve the current status of a job from the database.

How to use Cloud Backup REST APIs

Getting started

To get started with Cloud Backup APIs, obtain a user token, a Cloud Central account ID, and the Cloud Connector ID. When making API calls, add the user token in the Authorization header and the Cloud Connector ID in the x-agent-id header. Use the Cloud Central account ID in the APIs.

Obtain a user token from NetApp Cloud Central.

Make sure to generate the refresh token from the following link: https://services.cloud.netapp.com/refresh-token/. The refresh token is an alpha-numeric string that is used to generate a user token. 

curl -X GET "https://netapp-cloud-account.auth0.com/oauth/token?=" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d   "{'grant_type': 'refresh_token', 'refresh_token': 'JxaVHn9cGkX92aPVCkhat3zxxxxxwsC9qMl_pLHkZtsVA', 'client_id': 'Mu0V1ywgYteI6w1MbD15fKfVIUrNXGWC'} "

Obtain your NetApp Cloud Central account ID

curl -X GET "https://cloudmanager.cloud.netapp.com/tenancy/account" -H "accept: application/json"  -H "'authority: cloudmanager.cloud.netapp.com'" -H "'accept-language: en-GB,en;q=0.9'"  -H "'authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR……"

This API returns a response like the following. You can retrieve the account ID by parsing the output from [0].[ accountPublicId].

Response:

"[{"accountPublicId":"account-i6vJXvZW","accountName":"rashidn","isSaas":true,"isGov":false,"isPrivatePreviewEnabled":false,"is3rdPartyServicesEnabled":false,"accountSerial":"96064469711530003565","userRole":"Role-1"}………"

Obtain the x-agent-id that contains the Cloud Manager Connector ID.

curl -X GET "https://api.services.cloud.netapp.com/occm/list-occms/account-OOnAR4ZS?excludeStandalone=true&source=saas" -H "accept: application/json"  -H "'authority: api.services.cloud.netapp.com'" -H "'accept-language: en-GB,en;q=0.9'"  -H "'authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR……"

This API will return a response like the following. You can retrieve the agent ID by parsing the output from occm.[0].[agent].[agentId].

Response:

"{"occms":[{"account":"account-OOnAR4ZS","accountName":"cbs","occm":"imEdsEW4HyYTFbt8ZcNKTKDF05jMIe6Z","agentId":"imEdsEW4HyYTFbt8ZcNKTKDF05jMIe6Z","status":"ready","occmName":"cbsgcpdevcntsg-asia","primaryCallbackUri":"","manualOverrideUris":[],"automaticCallbackUris":[],"createDate":"1652120369286","agent":{"useDockerInfra":true,"network":"default","name":"cbsgcpdevcntsg-asia","agentId":"imEdsEW4HyYTFbt8ZcNKTKDF05jMIe6Zclients","provider":"gcp","systemId":"a3aa3578-bfee-4d16-9e10-"

Example using the APIs

The following example shows an API call to activate a backup on a working environment with a new policy that has daily, hourly, and weekly labels set, and archive after days set as 180 days in East-US-2 region in Azure cloud. This enables backup only on a working environment but no volumes are backed up. If you choose “"auto-backup-enabled": true, then any volumes already existing in the system are backed up and future volumes added. 

curl -X GET "https://cloudmanager.cloud.netapp.com/account/account-DpTFcxN3/providers/cloudmanager_cbs/api/v3/backup/working-environment/VsaWorkingEnvironment-99hPYEgk" -H "accept: application/json"  -H "'x-agent-id: iZwFFeVCZjWnzGlw8RgD0QQNANZvpP7Iclients'"  -H "'authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR……" -d "{"provider":"AZURE","backup-policy": {"archive-after-days": 180,"rule": [{"label": "hourly","retention": "2"},{"label": "daily","retention": "30"},{"label": "weekly", "retention": "52"}]},"ip-space": "Default","region": "eastus2","azure": {"resource-group": "rn-test-backup-rg",     "subscription": "3beb4dd0-25d4-464f-9bb0-303d7cf5c0c2"}}"

post.description:
Starts a file explore operation while initiating a single file restore (SFR) operation. This API endpoint implements single or multiple file restore operations that work on "default" integration mode. This API endpoint is currently supported on Cloud Volumes ONTAP on Amazon Web Service (AWS), Azure, Google Cloud, and on-premises ONTAP systems. It supports retrieving files from AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and StorageGRID cloud storage providers.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Returns the file explore status when you initiate a single or multiple file restore operation. This API endpoint also returns the deployment status of an Active Data Connector container during the restore process and the overall status of the file listing operation.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Returns the file explore status when you initiate a single or multiple file restore operation. This API endpoint also returns the deployment status of an Active Data Connector container during the restore process and the overall status of the file listing operation.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of the files contained in the specified volume Snapshot copy for a single or multiple file restore operation. The volume Snapshot copy is mounted on the Connector instance to create a file catalog for the "Browse and Restore" option.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of files within a specified volume Snapshot copy in a paginated fashion during a single or multiple file restore operation (V2 version of the file-explore/list API). You can pass the number of pages and limit of the number of files that the API endpoint must retrieve while fetching the details in a paginated format. The volume Snapshot copy is mounted on the Connector instance to create a file catalog for the "Browse and Restore" option.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves the details of working environments that are backed up by using Cloud Backup within an account. This endpoint is routed through the SaaS interface to retrieve the details of a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves the details of a specific working environment backed up by using Cloud Backup within an account. This API endpoint is routed through the SaaS interface to retrieve the details of a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables Cloud Backup for a particular working environment. The API endpoint enables Cloud Backup on Cloud Volumes ONTAP on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and on-premises ONTAP systems. It checks and retrieves the storage account details that have been created for a specified account of the selected cloud provider. If an S3 object store storage bucket does not exist, it will create a bucket. Then, it configures the object store in ONTAP and creates a SnapMirror policy if the chosen SnapMirror policy does not exist.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

account-id.description: Required when the provider is AWS for on-premises use case

resource-group.description: Required when the provider is Azure for on-premises use case

storage-account.description: Required when the provider is Azure for on-premises use case

subscription.description: Required when the provider is Azure for on-premises use case

project-id.description: Required when the provider is Google Cloud for on-premises use case

provider.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

storage-server.description: StorageGRID server URL. Required input field for StorageGRID provider

ip-space.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

access-key.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

secret-password.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

put.description:
Modifies Cloud Backup for a working environment. You can modify the state and backup policy name.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

state.description: Updates the SnapMirror relationship state in the working environment to the state specified

backup-policy-name.description: Policy name of the existing policy

parameters.description: Working environment ID of the source Cloud Volumes ONTAP environment
parameters.name: workingEnvironmentId

delete.description:
Unregisters a working environment. You can remove Cloud Backup service from a working environment. Before you unregister, make sure that you delete all backups and disable Cloud Backup on a working environment. This action also deletes the backup folder.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves the backup status of a specified working environment backed up by using Cloud Backup within an account. This API endpoint is routed through the Cloud Manager SaaS interface to retrieve the details of a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables Cloud Backup for a specified working environment synchronously (V2 version). This endpoint enables Cloud Backup on Cloud Volumes ONTAP on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and on-premises ONTAP systems. It checks and retrieves storage account details that have been created for a specified account on the selected cloud provider. If an S3 object store bucket does not exist, it creates the bucket. Then, it configures an object store on ONTAP and creates a SnapMirror policy if the chosen SnapMirror policy does not exist.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

account-id.description: Required when the provider is AWS for on-premises use case

resource-group.description: Required when the provider is Azure for on-premises use case

storage-account.description: Required when the provider is Azure for on-premises use case

subscription.description: Required when the provider is Azure for on-premises use case

project-id.description: Required when the provider is Google Cloud for on-premises use case

provider.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

storage-server.description: StorageGRID server URL. Required input field for StorageGRID provider

ip-space.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

access-key.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

secret-password.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

put.description:
Modifies Cloud Backup backup configuration for a particular working environment synchronously (V2). You can modify the state, backup policy, archive storage class, and enable auto backup.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

state.description: Updates the SnapMirror relationship state in the working environment to the state specified

backup-policy.description: Uses an existing policy or creates a new policy if not found in the list of ONTAP policies and modifies the backed up working environment relationships to use the existing one.

name.description: Policy name of the existing policy or any custom name with which a new policy needs to be created. If not specified, a policy with Cloud Backup default naming convention is created.

rule.description: Specify the rules for new policy

archive-storage-class.description: Required for AWS when modifying the storage class or enabling archive for the first time.

parameters.description: Working environment ID of the source Cloud Volumes ONTAP environment
parameters.name: workingEnvironmentId

post.description:
Enables Cloud Backup for a specific working environment.The V3 version of this API endpoint enables Cloud Backup on Cloud Volumes ONTAP on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and on-premises ONTAP systems. It checks if an S3 cloud storage bucket is associated with an account. If a bucket does not exist, it will create the bucket. It creates a backup folder on the S3 cloud object storage bucket in the specified cloud provider or in StorageGRID. The ability to tier older backup files to archival storage requires the cluster to run ONTAP 9.10.1 or later (currently supported with AWS and Azure). Restoring volumes from backup objects that reside in archival storage also requires the destination cluster to run ONTAP 9.10.1 or later.

You can enable DataLock and ransomware protection beginning with ONTAP 9.11.1 and later. This is applicable only for new backup activation. Interoperability with an archival policy is not supported. A new object-lock parameter is available to enable DataLock and ransomware protection in "GOVERNANCE" mode or "COMPLIANCE" mode.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

provider.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

account-id.description: Required when the provider is AWS

access-key.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

secret-password.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

kms-key-id.description: Optional input field for customer managed key use case

id.description: Optional input field for a private endpoint

archive-storage-class.description: Required for AWS to specify which storage class to use for archiving

resource-group.description: Required when the provider is Azure

storage-account.description: Required when the provider is Azure

subscription.description: Required when the provider is Azure

private-endpoint.description: Required input field for on-premises use case for private link configuration

subnet.description: Required input field for on-premises private link configuration

project-id.description: Required when the provider is Google Cloud

access-key.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

secret-password.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

storage-server.description: StorageGRID server URL. Required input field for StorageGRID provider

access-key.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

secret-password.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

ip-space.description: Required input field for on-premises use case

post.description:
Enables backup for a specified volume. Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure optional backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an ad hoc Snapshot copy and creates a backup on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates a Snapshot copy as per the ONTAP snapshot policy and creates a backup on the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, the API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to Cloud relationship with a specific cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

mode.description: AD_HOC mode creates an ad hoc Snapshot copy and backs it up on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode creates Snapshot copies as per the ONTAP Snapshot policy and backs it up on the cloud as per the backup policy.

get.description:
Retrieves information of a specified volume backed up by using the Cloud Backup service. It retrieves the details of the volume from the Cloud Manager SaaS application. It retrieves backup status, relationship policy name, and details. It also retrieves object lock, ransomware scan status, last ransomware scan details, and ransomware detected Snapshot copies with last ransomware scan information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

put.description:
Modifies a specified backed up volume. You can use this API endpoint to modify the volume state, backup policy, backup policy rule-retention, and archive-after-days parameters.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

delete.description:
Removes the backup settings on a specified backed up volume. To remove a backup from a volume, you must delete the Snapshot copies taken for the volume.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables backup for a specified volume (version 2). Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure the different backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and stores a backup on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates Snapshot copies as per the ONTAP Snapshot copy policy and stores a backup on the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, this API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to cloud relationship with a specific cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

mode.description: AD_HOC mode creates an ad hoc Snapshot copy and backs it up on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode creates a Snapshot copy as per the ONTAP Snapshot policy and backs it up to the cloud as per the backup policy.

post.description:
Enables backup for a specified volume (version 3). This version of the endpoint runs the job asynchronously. Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure the different backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and stores a backup on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates Snapshot copies as per the ONTAP Snapshot copy policy and stores a backup on the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, this API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to cloud relationship with a specific cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

mode.description: AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and backs it up on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode creates Snapshot copies as per the ONTAP Snapshot policy and backs it up to the cloud as per the backup policy.

get.description:
Retrieves details of all the volumes for a specified working environment backed up by using Cloud Backup. It retrieves the volume name, volume type, protocol, storage VM, backup status, last backup creation time, Snapshot copy count, associated backup policy, and backup policy rules. It also retrieves object lock mode, ransomware scan status, last ransomware scan details, and ransomware detected Snapshot copies.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

parameters.description: Returns only partial response from Cloud backup service database. API call with this query parameter skips fetching data from ONTAP
parameters.name: partial

post.description:
Enables the backup of multiple volumes. Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a NetApp SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure the different optional backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and stores a backup on the respective cloud object storage. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates a Snapshot copy as per the ONTAP Snapshot policy and stores a backup on the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, this API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to cloud relationship with a specific cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

put.description:
Modifies multiple backed-up volumes in a specific working environment. This API endpoint modifies the volume state, backup-policy, backup policy rule and retention, and archive-after-days parameters.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables backup for multiple volumes (version 2). Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure the different backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and stores a backup on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates Snapshot copies as per the ONTAP Snapshot policy and stores a backup on the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, this API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to cloud relationship with a cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves the information of a Snapshot copy for a specified volume backed up by using Cloud Backup for a working environment. This API endpoint retrieves the details of the volume Snapshot copies from the Cloud manager SaaS application. It retrieves the Snapshot name, Snapshot creation time, archive status, and size. It also retrieves the object-lock, ransomware-scan-status-failure, and ransomware-scan-status information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

delete.description:
Deletes a specified Snapshot copy for a specified volume backed up by using Cloud Backup for a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves Snapshot copy information for a specified volume backed up by using Cloud Backup for a working environment. This API endpoint retrieves the details of the volume Snapshot copies from the Cloud Manager SaaS application. It retrieves the Snapshot name, Snapshot creation time, archive status, and size. It also retrieves the object-lock, ransomware-scan-status-failure, and ransomware-scan-status information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

delete.description:
Deletes all the Snapshot copies for a specified volume backed up by using Cloud Backup for a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Deletes all the Snapshot copies for a specified working environment backed up by using Cloud Backup (V2 version).

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Performs a volume and file-level restore operation. This API endpoint validates whether a backup of a volume exists. Restore is not supported on data protection volumes. A restore operation is not supported on a target volume with a different language code than the source volume. A restore operation is not supported for volumes with a size less than 1 GB. Restore is not allowed on a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). It checks whether the source and target cloud providers match. It also verifies whether the backup and restore operation is supported on the specified working environments.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Performs a volume and file level restore (version 2) operation. This API validates whether a backup of a volume exists. A restore operation is not supported on data protection volumes. A restore operation is not supported on a target volume with a different language code than the source volume. A restore operation is not supported for volumes with a size less than 1 GB. Restore is not allowed on a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). It checks whether the source and target cloud providers match. It also verifies whether the backup and restore operation is supported in the working environments.

You can enable DataLock and ransomware protection beginning in ONTAP 9.11.1 and later. By default, a ransomware scan is performed on a specified cloud backup pertaining to a particular volume Snapshot copy when it is chosen to be restored. To skip the scan, set the "skip-ransomware-check" parameter to "true".

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

archive-restore-priority.description: Required to specify the archival retrieval priority to determine the restoration time

get.description:
Retrieves the status of a volume-level restore operation. This API endpoint tracks the restore job and retrieves the job status, error, time, and details of the restore job.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of ONTAP backup policies associated with a working environment. You can filter the policies based on the archival enablement status. This API endpoint retrieves the backup-policy name, rule, attached volume count, archive-after-days, and object-lock mode information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

parameters.description: Filters policies based on the archival enablement status
parameters.name: archived

post.description:
Creates a backup policy in a working environment. You can have up to a maximum of 1018 retained backups when no backup policies are assigned to the volume. You can edit a policy to create up to 4000 backups after you assign volumes to a policy through the ONTAP CLI. This API endpoint validates whether the ONTAP version used by a working environment supports archiving.

You can enable DataLock and ransomware protection in ONTAP 9.11.1 and later. A new "object-lock" parameter is available to you to create a Cloud Backup policy with DataLock and ransomware protection in "GOVERNANCE" mode or "COMPLIANCE" mode. Note that interoperability with an archival policy is not supported.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

put.description:
Updates a backup policy in a working environment. This API endpoint modifies the rule, label-rule, retention, and archive-after-days information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

archive-after-days.description: Archive after days value to which the policy will be modified. "never" implies the removal of the archive-after-days property from a backup policy

put.description:
Updates a backup policy in a working environment. This API endpoint modifies the rule, label-rule, retention, and archive-after-days information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

archive-after-days.description: Archive after days value to which the policy will be modified. "never" implies the removal of the archive-after-days property from a backup policy

get.description:
Retrieves a list of IP spaces within a specified working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of working environments and their details. This API endpoint retrieves the name, region, status, type, cloud-provider, provider-accountId, ontap-version, and total-volumes-count information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

provider-account-id.description: AWS account ID/ Azure subscription ID / Google Cloud project ID

get.description:
Retrieves the details of a specific working environment. This API endpoint retrieves the name, region, status, type, cloud-provider, provider-accountId, ontap-version, and total-volumes-count of a specific working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

provider-account-id.description: AWS account ID/ Azure subscription ID / Google Cloud project ID

get.description:
Retrieves a list of storage VMs and their details from a specific working environment. This API retrieves the ID, name, and aggregate list that belongs to a storage VM.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of volumes and their details from a specific working environment. This API endpoint retrieves the name, file-system-id, status, storage VM, type, style, capacity allocated, capacity used, and SnapMirror label information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Configures object storage. Verifies whether a private endpoint is enabled and a certificate is installed. This API endpoint is called if no object stores are found when Cloud Backup service is enabled.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Configures object storage. This is V2 version of the object store configure API. It verifies whether a private endpoint is enabled and a certificate is installed. This API endpoint is called if no object stores are found when Cloud Backup service is enabled.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

account-id.description: Required when the provider is AWS

id.description: Optional input field for private endpoint

subscription.description: Required when the provider is Azure

private-endpoint.description: Required input field for on-premises use case for private link configuration

subnet.description: Required input field for on-premises private link configuration

get.description:
Retrieves a list of working environment volume directories. You can a query by using a target storage VM and path of directories to browse within the volume.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

parameters.description: Path of directories to browse within volume
parameters.name: path

get.description:
Retrieves an object store configuration status. It uses the GET /api/cloud/targets ONTAP REST APIs to retrieve the details.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of AWS accounts from Cloud Manager.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of subscribed AWS regions from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of AWS keys from a specified region that belongs to a specified AWS account ID from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of AWS private links from a specified region that belongs to a specified AWS account ID from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of AWS storage classes for archival support from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of regions from a specific subscription ID in Azure from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Creates an Azure resource group in the specified subscription ID.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

name.description: Name of the resource group to be created

region.description: Region where the resource group needs to be created

get.description:
Retrieves a list of Azure resource groups from a specific subscription ID in Azure from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Azure virtual networks from a specific subscription ID in Azure cloud from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Azure subscriptions for a particular account from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Azure vault keys from a particular vault for a specific subscription ID in Azure cloud from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Azure vaults for a specific subscription ID in Azure cloud from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Google Cloud projects from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of regions from a specific Google Cloud project from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Configures the service to include indexed cataloging services. This API endpoint initiates the creation of an S3 bucket on an account level for cataloging to store the details of the backup and changes. It also enables the AWS Athena interactive S3 query service and AWS Glue serverless data integration service to coordinate with the new catalog feature.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Configures the service to include indexed cataloging services. This API endpoint initiates the creation of an S3 bucket on an account level for cataloging to store the details of the backup and changes. It also enables the AWS Athena interactive S3 query service and AWS Glue serverless data integration service to coordinate with the new catalog feature.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Searches for a specific file from the backups taken by the Cloud Backup service. It can also search for a specified volume. It is possible to narrow down your file search based on a particular working environment, file extension, size range, creation date range, and location of a backup.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Snapshot copies pertaining to a particular volume by using the catalog index query.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

put.description:
Enables or disables the indexed cataloging service for a specified working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

state.description: Modifies all SnapMirror relationship states in the working environment to the state specified

get.description:
Retrieves the license validity of the working environments from the Cloud Manager SaaS application. This API retrieves the eligibility of the current license used and returns the days remaining if you are using a trial license.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

parameters.description: Cloud provider account ID. AWS account ID/Azure subscription ID/ Google Cloud project ID. It is not mandatory to send this query parameter for StorageGRID
parameters.name: cloudProviderAccountId

get.description:
Retrieves a list of jobs from the database using the Cloud Manager backend service API endpoint. It lists all jobs pertaining to a Tenancy account. It is also possible to list the sub-jobs under a parent job. You can query based on the job type (volume_backup, restore), job status (RUNNING, COMPLETED, QUEUED, WARNING, FAILED), service type (CBS, SnapCenterService, K8s), and user.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

startTime.description: Time in milliseconds when the job started

endTime.description: Time in milliseconds when the job ended

data.description: JSON data containing data specific to a job

parentJobId.description: Job ID of the parent job under which the current job must be grouped

error.description: Any error that might have occurred in the job execution

lastUpdateTime.description: Last update time for the job

post.description:
Registers a job and creates an entry in the Cloud Backup database by using this Cloud Manager backend service API endpoint. You can register a new job with a job name, job type (volume_backup, restore), job status (RUNNING, COMPLETED, QUEUED, WARNING, FAILED), service type (CBS, SnapCenterService, K8S), start time, description, error, and resolution.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

startTime.description: Time in milliseconds when the job started

data.description: JSON data containing data specific to a job

parentJobId.description: Job ID of the parent job under which the current job must be grouped

schema.description: Job ID of the newly created job

id.description: Job ID of the newly created job

get.description:
Retrieves the details of a specific job from the database by using the Cloud Manager backend service API endpoint. It retrieves the ID, job type (volume_backup, restore), job status (RUNNING, COMPLETED, QUEUED, WARNING, FAILED), service type (CBS, SnapCenterService, K8S), start time, end time, and user details of a specific job and its sub-jobs . It also retrieve the description, error, resolution, and last update time of the job.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

startTime.description: Time in milliseconds when the job started

endTime.description: Time in milliseconds when the job ended

data.description: JSON data containing data specific to a job

parentJobId.description: Job ID of the parent job under which the current job must be grouped

lastUpdateTime.description: Last update time for the job

startTime.description: Time in milliseconds when the job started

endTime.description: Time in milliseconds when the job ended

data.description: JSON data containing data specific to a job

parentJobId.description: Job ID of the parent job under which the current job must be grouped

lastUpdateTime.description: Last update time for the job

patch.description:
Updates a specific job in the Cloud Backup database by using the Cloud Manager backend service API endpoint. You can modify the job status (RUNNING, COMPLETED, QUEUED, WARNING, FAILED), job description, job end time, error, and resolution.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

data.description: JSON data containing data specific to a job

endTime.description: Time in milliseconds when the job ended

schema.description: Job ID of the newly created job

delete.description:
Deletes a specific job in the Cloud Backup database by using the Cloud Manager backend service API endpoint.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

schema.description: Job ID of the newly created job

id.description: Job ID of the newly created job

post.description:
Initiates a ransomware scan on a specified cloud backup pertaining to volume Snapshot copy transferred by the SnapMirror - Cloud engine to the cloud object storage system. It scans only cloud backups. It does not support scanning local Snapshot copies. Ransomware attacks on local Snapshot copies cannot be detected.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

tags.name: SFR
tags.description:
Overview

The single file restore (SFR) endpoints retrieve files from volume Snapshot copies.

You can perform the following operations by using the SFR endpoints:

  • Retrieve file explore status.

  • List files during file explore operations.

  • Unexport a file system.

tags.name: Backup
tags.description:
Overview

The backup endpoints manage backup operations of cloud and on-premises resources and retrieve details of the backup data when required. You can perform the following operations by using the Backup endpoints.

  • Retrieve details of the backup data of a working environment, volumes, and Snapshot copies

  • Enable backups on a working environment, back up volumes, and create on-demand backups

  • Modify the backup configuration of working environments and volumes

  • Disable backups for working environments and volumes, and delete backups

tags.name: Restore
tags.description:
Overview

The restore endpoints enable you to perform volume and file-level restore operations. You can perform the following operations by using the Restore endpoints:

  • Restore volumes and files

  • Retrieve volume and file restore status

tags.name: Working environment
tags.description:
Overview

The working environment endpoints manage the backup policies and configure an object store associated with a working environment.

You can perform the following operations by using the working environment endpoints:

  • Retrieve the list and details of working environments, backup policies, IP spaces, storage VMs, and volumes

  • Create a backup policy and configure an object store

  • List working environment volume directories

  • Modify a backup policy

tags.name: Cloud
tags.description:
Overview

The cloud endpoints enable you to retrieve information about various resources of the AWS, Azure, Google Cloud providers from the Cloud Manager platform.

You can perform the following actions by using the Cloud endpoints:

  • Retrieve the accounts, AWS region keys, AWS region private-links, AWS archival storage-class, Azure subscription, Azure subscription regions, Azure subscription resource-group, Azure subscription VNet, Azure subscription vault key, Google Cloud projects, Google Cloud project region, and more.

  • Create a subscription resource-group

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description:
Overview

The jobs endpoints list, register, update, and delete job detail entries on the Cloud Manager SaaS application database. The job monitoring APIs are handled by a different service called Cloud Backup backend. Therefore, the jobs API endpoint URL starts with "cbs_backend" service name.

You can perform the following operation by using the jobs endpoints:

  • Retrieve job and sub-job details from the database

  • Create job entries in the database

  • Update job entries in the database.

  • Delete job entries in the database.

tags.name: Catalog
tags.description:
Overview

The catalog endpoints manage the indexed catalog search for files based on a query. You can perform the following operations by using the Catalog endpoints:

  • Initiate an indexed catalog search based on a query

  • Retrieve a list of Snapshot copies pertaining to a particular volume by using the Catalog Index query

  • Configure an indexed catalog service

  • Modify the state of an indexed catalog service

tags.name: License
tags.description:
Overview

The license endpoints enable you to retrieve the license validity of the working environments from the Cloud Manager SaaS application. A valid license is required to activate Cloud Backup on a working environment, to create backups of your production data, and to restore backup data on a production system. This API retrieves the eligibility of the current license used and returns the days remaining if you are using a trial license.

tags.name: Ransomware Scan
tags.description:
Overview

The ransomware scan API endpoint enables you to initiate a ransomware scan on a specified Snapshot copy available in the cloud object-store bucket. It scans only cloud backups. It does not support scanning local Snapshot copies. Ransomware attacks on local Snapshot copies cannot be detected.
